title.narrative: STRENGTHENED INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY ON SERVICE DELIVERY

description.narrative: By 2023, institutional capacity to deliver quality child protection services, including in emergencies, is strengthened at provincial, communal and community levels, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice (Covid), Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, girls and boys, particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from a child protection system that effectively protects them from violence, abuse and exploitation, including in humanitarian situations

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, institutional capacity to deliver quality child protection services, including in emergencies, is strengthened atprovincial, communal and community levels

description.narrative: Since 2019,;UNICEF;has worked;with the;Government to;strengthen;the capacity and quality of protection services;for;children in humanitarian situations and;in 2021 reached;570,507 vulnerable children;(302,960 girls; 267,547 boys).;The;application;of child-friendly judicial procedures resulted in 273 children in contact with the law;receiving;legal;support.;The;case management system;set up;in;eight;provinces;in;2020;was strengthened in 2021 with;capacity-building,;coaching;and;follow-up.;Thanks to three;birth;registration campaigns in 2021,;176,847;children;(girls: 92,452; boys: 84,395;;344 children;with;disabilities) received birth certificates.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/12/2021
